page.title: 19SUPERNATURAL IN CHITTERNE
page.content: With the numerable ancient archaelogical sites the Plain area is rich in stories of ghostly visitations, but the immediate surroundings of Chitterne can only boast a few. Local reports speak of a Miss Adlem, whose aged, bonneted figure is supposed to frequent one of the upstairs rooms in St. Mary's Lodge. Another story is told at the King's Head Public House of a former landlord whose wife became involved with a lodger. No-one knows quite how he met his end, but his ghost is reported to haunt what is now the pool room. The area around Chitterne is said to be a centre of witchcraft through the ages and is mentioned in Dennis Wheatley's novels as a place where the Black Arts were practised.
